post.body: I've done fine with Tracfone, btw. Had them for years now, with an ancient phone.
Sleep well, young teacher / Enter night with no regrets / Leave with hopeful dreams.
Listening to the "Tea & Chat" interview. Glad you're still plugging along.
Tell me what you think of Randall's story in Hiber-Nation 46, too.
I've actually kept my New Years Resolution, sort of. I resolved not to make any New Years Resolutiions, and I've stuck by it.
Um, here it's below freezing and we're expecting 6 inches of snow. Sure it's "beautiful," looked at out the window. Brrrr.
Back in the day, maybe 50-60 WPM. These days, not really sure. Mavis keeps giving me punctuation to type.
I think my sister used to play "Lady of Sporks" on the accordion.
"Yeah, but can you wash your head with it?"
And to think I used to type for a living. (sigh)
Managed to get through the Hard Part in Mavis Beacon Teaches Typing, FINALLY! 55 WPM or so now.
Switched to a Natural keyboard, the one that splits in the middle. 10 WPM faster! My arms fit better around my belly this way, too. ;-0
Got a nice compliment on my latest show from a Nobel nominee the other day. Nobody I'd heard of, but I guess someone important.
Ooops. http://tinyurl.com/7zz7n7
is grinning like an idiot. Apparently people are -really- liking the original story from a friend, I read on Hiber-Nation 46: http://ti ...
Anybody looked at Snakr? http://snakr.net
I flunked typing twice in High School. Later, I spent 9 years as a professional, full-time, full-charge secretary. Now I can't type.
Getting there on the number keypad, though. That -has- to be fast.
Before I started practicing all those useless punctuation thingies, I was a pretty good typist. Now I forget how.
I don't wanna practice typing anymore. Can I go play now?
